capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: The role requires achieving conservation and maintenance outcomes efficiently.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: The officer needs to manage various tasks such as pest control, maintenance, and fire management effectively.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Problem-solving is essential for dealing with unexpected issues in conservation and maintenance work.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: The role requires adherence to safety and operational guidelines in a highly regulated environment.

capabilities.name: Manage Self
capabilities.description: Self-management is crucial due to the role's requirement for working independently or with minimal supervision.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Effective communication is needed for interacting with the community, team members, and during visitor enquiries.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: The role involves working as part of a team to achieve conservation goals.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Understanding and respecting Aboriginal cultural issues is a key aspect of the role.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Coordination and control methods are needed for asset construction and conservation works.

skills.name: Cultural Competency
skills.description: Ability to engage respectfully and effectively with Aboriginal communities.

skills.name: Safety Compliance
skills.description: Adherence to safety protocols and ability to obtain relevant certifications.

skills.name: Physical Fitness
skills.description: Maintain fitness levels required for fieldwork and firefighting duties.

generalRole.title: Field Conservation Officer
generalRole.description: This role involves a combination of field operations and environmental conservation tasks, including maintenance of park assets, pest and weed control, fire management, and supporting cultural heritage conservation within NSW National Parks. The role requires a blend of physical fitness, technical skills, and cultural competency, particularly in engaging with Aboriginal communities and respecting cultural heritage.
